question.content: Who among the following wrote the novel 'Kitne Pakistan', which won the Sahitya Akademi Award?

solution.content: Kamleshwar. He was awarded the 2003 Sahitya Akademi Award. Other novels: "Pati Patni Aur Woh",, "Samagra Upanyas".

question.content: Dronacharya Award was started in

solution.content: 1985. Dronacharya Award: The award comprises a bronze statuette of Dronacharya, a certificate, ceremonial dress, and a money prize of Rs 15 lakh (lifetime) and 10 Lakh (regular). The first recipients of the award were Bhalchandra Bhaskar Bhagwat (Wrestling), Om Prakash Bhardwaj (Boxing), and O. M. Nambiar (Athletics), who were honored in 1985.

question.content: Arjuna Award was introduced in

solution.content: 1961. Arjuna Award: Category Sports honour in India, Sponsored by Government of India. Other awards and their inception: Bharat Ratna (1954), Padma Vibhushan (1954), Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award (1991-1992), Dhyan Chand Award (2002), Dronacharya Award (1985), Noble prize (1901), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1952).

question.content: Devendra Jhajharia won which medal/place in World Para Athletics Grand Prix?

solution.content: Silver. Devendra Jhajharia: Indian Paralympic javelin thrower. He was the first Indian to win two gold medals at Paralympics. World Para Athletics Grand Prix, on 17 September 2022 - Held in Morocco. The first IPC Athletics World Championships were held in Berlin, Germany in 1994.

question.content: The former captain of the Indian women's hockey team _ was conferred with the BBC Lifetime Achievement Award for her contribution to Indian sports and inspiring generations of players.

solution.content: Pritam Siwach. Awards: Arjuna Award (1998), DronaCharya Awards (2021). Rani Rampal (Hockey Player) - Padma Shri (2020), Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award (2020), Vandana Kataria (Hockey player) - Padma Shri (2022), Arjun Award (2021), Savita Punia (Hockey Player) Arjun Award (2018).

question.content: Lata Mangeshkar was awarded India's highest civilian honor 'Bharat Ratna' in the year

solution.content: 2001. Lata Mangeshkar also known as the 'Nightingale of Bollywood' and Queen of Melody. Awards Padma Bhushan (1969), Padma Vibhushan (1999), Maharashtra Bhushan (1997). Lata Mangeshkar recorded her first song at age 13 for Kiti Hasaal (Marathi Movie)

question.content: Gurucharan Singh received the Padma Shri from the Government of India in 2023 for his contributions to the sport of

solution.content: Cricket. Gurucharan Singh is a cricket coach, the second cricket coach to be awarded the Dronacharya Award (1987) after Desh Prem Azad (awarded in 1986).

question.content: When was Kapil Dev awarded with Padma Shri Award?

solution.content: 1982. Kapil Dev (The Haryana Hurricane): He was the captain of the Indian cricket team when India lifted a World Cup trophy (1983). Awards - Padma Bhushan (1991), Arjuna Award for Cricket (1979), C. K. Nayudu Lifetime Achievement Award (2013).

question.content: Who received the Nobel Prize in 1901 for 'recognition of the extraordinary services rendered by the discovery of the laws of chemical dynamics and osmotic pressure in solutions'?

solution.content: Jacobus Henricus van't Hoff. Nobel Prize 1902 - Hermann Emil Fischer "in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by his work on sugar and purine synthesis". 1903- Svante August Arrhenius "in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered to the advancement of chemistry by his electrolytic theory of dissociation". 1906 Henri Moissan "in recognition of the great services rendered by him in his investigation and isolation of the element fluorine, and for the adoption in the service of science of the electric furnace called after him".

question.content: When did Linus Carl Pauling receive the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for 'his research into the nature of the chemical bond and its applications to the elucidation of the structure of complex substances'?

solution.content: 1954. Linus Carl Pauling was also awarded with the Nobel Peace Prize (1962). Some Scientists who won Nobel Prize in Chemistry: Otto Paul Hermann Diels and Kurt Alder (1950) - "for their discovery and development of the diene synthesis". Sir Cyril Norman Hinshelwood and Nikolay Semenov (1956) "for their research into the mechanism of chemical reactions". Frederick Sanger (1958)- "for his work on the structure of proteins, especially that of insulin".

question.content: For which discovery did William Bradford Shockley, John Bardeen and Walter Houser Brattain jointly receive the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1956?

options.text: Discovery of receptors for temperature and touch

solution.content: Discovery of transistor effect. Nobel Prize: Started in 1901, Alfred Nobel (discovered the Dynamite in 1867). Indian who recieved Nobel prize: First Rabindra Nath Tagore 1913 (Literature), Chandrashekhara Venkat Raman 1930 (Physics), Har Gobind Khorana - 1968 (Physiology or Medicine), Amartya sen - 1998 (Economics), Kailash Satyarthi -2014 (Peace).

question.content: Paramvir Chakra, Ashok Chakra and Vir Chakra are presented during the celebration of which day?

solution.content: Republic Day. Post -independence, the first three gallantry awards were Param Vir Chakra, Maha Vir Chakra, and Vir Chakra, instituted on 26th January 1950 (effective from 15th August 1947). Later, Ashoka Chakra Class-I, Class-II, and Class-III were instituted on 4th January 1952, renamed as Ashoka Chakra, Kirti Chakra, and Shaurya Chakra in January 1967. Order of precedence is Param Vir Chakra, Ashoka Chakra, Mahavir Chakra, Kirti Chakra, Vir Chakra, and Shaurya Chakra.

question.content: Who among the following was the first non-European to win a Nobel prize in 1913 in literature for his work 'Gitanjali'?

solution.content: Rabindranath Tagore Mystic, artist and Bengali polymath (great poet, philosopher, music composer and a leader of Brahma Samaj). Books written by Rabindranath Tagore Gora (Fair-Faced) and Ghare -Baire (The Home and the World). National anthem of India composed by Rabindranath Tagore.

question.content: Who among the following is a Nobel Laureate who is also known as the father of micro finance systems?

solution.content: Muhammad Yunus. He is a Bangladeshi social entrepreneur, banker, economist and civil society leader who was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize 2006 for founding the Grameen Bank and work to "create economic and social development from below".

question.content: Who along with Arthur Compton received the Nobel Prize in 1927 for the development of the cloud chamber for the detection of charged particles?

solution.content: Charles Wilson. Frederick Soddy A British chemist, won the 1921 Nobel Prize in chemistry for his research on radioactive decay and his formulation of the concept of isotopes. Ernest Lawrence Nobel Prize in Physics in 1939 for his invention of the cyclotron. Harold Urey Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1934 "for his discovery of deuterium, a heavy isotope of hydrogen".

question.content: Who received a Nobel Peace Prize for dismantling apartheid in South Africa?

solution.content: Nelson Mandela and Frederik Willem de Klerk received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993. Mahatma Gandhi (Symbol of non violence): Nominated for Nobel Peace Prize in 1937, 1938, 1939, 1947 and 1948 but never awarded the prize. Albert John Lutuli: Awarded the 1960 Nobel Peace Prize for his role in leading the non-violent anti -apartheid movement.

question.content: The Nobel Prize for Physics 2022 has been given in the field of:

solution.content: Quantum Mechanics: It is the study of how atomic particles exist and interact with each other. Nobel Prize 2022 awards: Physics (Alain Aspect, John F. Clauser and Anton Zeilinger), Chemistry (Carolyn R. Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K. Barry Sharpless), Medicine (Svante Paabo), Literature (Annie Ernaux), Peace (Ales Bialiatski, the Russian human rights organisation, Ukrainian Center for Civil Liberties), Economics (Ben S. Bernanke, Douglas W. Diamond and Philip H. Dybvig).

question.content: Which citizen of the Republic of India was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in the year 2014?

solution.content: Kailash Satyarthi. The Nobel Peace Prize 2014 was awarded jointly to Kailash Satyarthi and Malala Yousafzai "for their struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education".

question.content: The first woman to win the Dronacharya Award was weightlifting coach in 2000.

solution.content: Hansa Sharma. The Dronacharya award contains a medallion, a certificate, and a money prize of Rs 15 lakh (lifetime) and 10 Lakh (regular). First awarded (1985) Bhalachandra Bhaskar Bhagwat (Wrestling), Om Prakash Bhardwaj (Boxing), Ðž. M. Nambiar (Athletics).

question.content: Who was conferred with the Ashok Chakra for his gallantry in 26/11 Mumbai terrorist attacks?

solution.content: Hemant Karkare was the chief of the Mumbai Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS). He was killed in action during the 2008 Mumbai attacks. In 2009, he was posthumously given the Ashoka Chakra, India's highest peacetime gallantry decoration.

question.content: Which Indian music director was awarded Japan's Fukuoka prize 2016 for his outstanding contribution in creating, preserving and showcasing South Asian traditional fusion music?

solution.content: A.R. Rahman. Padma Shri (2000), Padma Bhushan (2010), two Grammy Awards (both in 2010).

question.content: On 8 February 2009, for the 51 st Grammy Awards, won in the category Contemporary World Music Album for his collaborative album Global Drum Project along with Mickey Hart, Sikiru Adepoju and Giovanni Hidalgo.

solution.content: Zakir Hussain. Anindo Chatterjee, tabla player of the Farukhabad gharana school. Kumar Bose (Tabla, Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 2007). Swapan Chaudhuri {Tabla, Padma Shri (2019), Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1997)}.

question.content: Who among the following is the first singer to be presented with India's highest civilian honour, the Bharat Ratna?

solution.content: Madurai Shanmukhavadivu Subbulakshmi. Awards - Bharat Ratna in 1998, Padma Bhushan in 1954, Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1956.

question.content: Which of the following awards has been conferred upon Kailash Kher?

solution.content: Padma Shri (2017). Kailash Kher is an Indian playback singer and music composer.

question.content: Bessie Award is a dance award given in which country?

solution.content: U.S.A. Bessie Awards (The New York Dance and Performance Awards; Established in 1983) are awarded annually to dance artists presenting their work in New York City.

question.content: Who among the following Indian musicians received the 'Best Original Song' award for his composition in 'Slumdog Millionaire', at Oscars 2009?

solution.content: AR Rahman. He was awarded the Grammy Award for Best Song Written for Visual Media (2010), Jai Ho!.

question.content: Which Indian actress was also one of the dancers to be honoured with the 'Padma Shri' award in 1968?

solution.content: Vyjayanthimala. Award: Padma Vibhushan (2024).

question.content: The South Indian film dance choreographer, K Shivashankar, won which of the following prestigious awards in 2010 for the best choreography in the Telugu film Magadheera?

solution.content: National Film Award. The most prominent film award ceremony in India. Established in 1954. It has been administered by the Indian government's Directorate of Film Festivals since 1973.

question.content: Who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1926, 'for his work on the discontinuous structure of matter'?

solution.content: Jean Baptiste Perrin. Charles Thomson Rees Wilson (1927; for his invention of the cloud chamber). Murray Gell- Mann (1969; for the classification of elementary particles and their interactions). Owen Willans Richardson (1928; for his work on the thermionic phenomenon and especially for the discovery of the law named after him).

question.content: Who among the following personalities, also associated with poetry and Music has been conferred with the Nobel Prize?

solution.content: Rabindranath Tagore is best known as a poet, and in 1913 was the first non-European writer to be awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature (Gitanjali).

question.content: In which year was the International Booker Prize established?

solution.content: 2005. 2022- Geetanjali Shree (Tomb of Sand), 2021 - David Diop (At Night All Blood Is Black).

question.content: Who among the following was the first Dr Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar awardee?

solution.content: KS Krishnan. Dr Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar award: The purpose of the award is to recognise outstanding Indian work in science and technology.

question.content: In which discipline is the Bidhan Chandra Roy Award given

solution.content: Medicine. The Bidhan Chandra Roy Award was instituted in 1962. Legal Era Awards given in the field of law. The Pritzker Prize award is given in the Architecture field.

question.content: Who among the following is the first Indian to get an Oscar Award?

solution.content: Bhanu Athaiya. She was a costume designer in more than 100 movies and won an Oscar award in 1983 for the movie 'Gandhi'.

question.content: The is Gitanjali Literary Prize awarded in association with which country?

solution.content: France. The Gitanjali Literary prize has two aims: to contribute to the promotion of the French language in India and also to the promotion of Indian works in France.

question.content: The 'Amrita Devi Bishnoi National Award' is given for:

solution.content: wildlife protection. The 'Amrita Devi Bishnoi National Award' is in remembrance of Amrita Devi Bishnoi, who died in the 1730 Khejarli massacre while trying to protect a grove of Khejri trees in Khejarli, Rajasthan.

question.content: Who among the following was the first recipient of Padma Vibhushan?

solution.content: Satyendra Nath Bose along with Nandalal Bose, Zakir Husain, Balasaheb Gangadhar Kher, V. K. Krishna Menon, and Jigme Dorji Wangchuck (Bhutan), who were honoured with Padma Vibhushan in 1954.

question.content: The Ramon Magsaysay Award was established in the year

solution.content: 1957. Ramon Magsaysay Award is an annual award established to perpetuate former Philippine President Ramon Magsaysay's example of integrity in governance, courageous service to the people, and pragmatic idealism within a democratic society.

question.content: The ICTP Ramanujan Prize is awarded annually for excellence in _

solution.content: Mathematics. The prize is named after the Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan. It was founded in 2004 and was first awarded in 2005. Another Award, SASTRA Ramanujan Prize was established in 2005

question.content: Which of the following organizations awards the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences?

solution.content: The Royal Swedish Academy Sciences. It was first awarded in 1969 to Dutch economist Jan Tinbergen and Norwegian economist Ragnar Frisch "for having developed and applied dynamic models for the analysis of economic processes.

question.content: Who is the first Indian to have won the Pulitzer Prize?

solution.content: Gobind Behari Lal. He was an Indian-American journalist and independence activist. He won the Pulitzer in 1937 in the journalism category. Pulitzer Prize - First awarded - 1917. Presented by Columbia University. Awarded for Excellence in newspaper journalism, literary achievements, musical composition.

question.content: The Indira Gandhi Award for National Integration is accorded by the:

options.text: Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India
Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India

solution.content: Indian National Congress. This award was qiven for the first time in 1985. It is given on Indira Gandhi's martyrdom day (31st October) and it carries an amount of 10 lakh in cash and a citation.

question.content: Which American President won the Nobel Peace Prize?

solution.content: Barack Obama. He was awarded in 2009 for his "extraordinary efforts to strengthen international diplomacy and cooperation between people."

question.content: Who among the following was the first recipient of the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award?

solution.content: Viswanathan Anand. He is an Indian chess grandmaster and also the former world champion. Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award (Dhyanchand Khel Ratna) is given for the spectacular and most outstanding performance in the field of sports by a sportsperson over a period of four years. The award was started in the year 1991-92.

question.content: Name the first actor to win the Oscar Awards?

solution.content: Emil Jannings. The first Academy Awards ceremony was held in Hollywood on May 16, 1929.
